main event: Several UFO sightings were reported in Wichita Falls, Texas, on 9 July 1953, involving circular or disc-shaped objects moving at high speeds and exhibiting sudden changes in direction before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The observed objects were described as silvery-white, circular, and slightly concave on the underside, with no sound or trailing flames, and traveling at very fast speeds.
One witness reported a pulsating, bluish-white light emitting from the object, which appeared to be completely silent and gave off no exhaust or vapor trails.
Multiple military personnel and airmen, including experienced officers, were involved in the sightings, providing consistent and reliable observations of the UFOs.

One witness reported that the object appeared to be about 10-15 feet in diameter and remained stationary for approximately 3 minutes before suddenly shooting straight up into the air and disappearing from view.

The reported UFO sightings included observations of objects descending and ascending vertically, maintaining a straight course unaffected by the wind, and moving at estimated speeds of 800 to 1000 miles per hour.
